Rootstock, a Bitcoin sidechain for smart contracts, announced a major three-pronged upgrade that boosts its scalability, security, and decentralization.

The post Rootstock Reveals Three Major Upgrades, 60% Lower Transaction Fees appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Ledger Claims Trezor Safe Devices Remain Vulnerable to Supply Chain Attacks
item.description:
Ledger claims Trezor Safe devices, despite upgrades, are still vulnerable to supply chain attacks targeting their microcontrollers, raising concerns about firmware integrity. Although Trezor has patched the flaw, some risks remain.

The post Ledger Claims Trezor Safe Devices Remain Vulnerable to Supply Chain Attacks appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Anthony Scaramucci Predicts $200K Bitcoin by Year-End as BTC Bull Token ICO Hits $3.5M – Offers Real BTC Airdrops
item.description:
The BTC Bull Token’s ($BTCBULL) presale had passed the $3.5 million mark on Thursday, coinciding with growing optimism among crypto figures that Bitcoin ($BTC) could reach new price levels before year-end.One of those voices is SkyBridge Capital founder Anthony Scaramucci, who predicts Bitcoin could hit $200,000 in 2025. While that may seem ambitious given BTC’s […]

The post Anthony Scaramucci Predicts $200K Bitcoin by Year-End as BTC Bull Token ICO Hits $3.5M – Offers Real BTC Airdrops appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Lazarus Group Deposits 400 ETH to Tornado Cash, Hackers Target Crypto Vets on Zoom
item.description:
The notorious Lazarus Group continues moving the crypto funds it has stolen in recent exploits. Now, the alleged North Korean hackers are targeting crypto execs via Zoom.

The post Lazarus Group Deposits 400 ETH to Tornado Cash, Hackers Target Crypto Vets on Zoom appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.description:
Cryptocurrency adoption in Latin America is on the rise, with more investors diversifying their portfolios, according to report from Bitso.

item.title: Crypto Trader Warns: Move Your Pi Coins To Pi Wallet Before March 14

Crypto trader Alts King has warned Pi Network users to transfer their Pi coins to their Pi Wallet before March 14 to avoid potential risks.

item.title: Bybit CEO Questions DEXs’ Risk Controls After Hyperliquid ETH Liquidation
item.description:
Bybit CEO Ben Zhou questioned DEX risk controls after Hyperliquid's $4M ETH liquidation, advocating for dynamic risk limits to prevent similar high-leverage losses.

The post Bybit CEO Questions DEXs’ Risk Controls After Hyperliquid ETH Liquidation appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: [$] Warming up to frozen pages for networking
item.description: When the 6.14 kernel is released later this month, it will include the usual set of internal changes that users should never notice, with the possible exception of changes that bring performance improvements. One of those changes is frozen pages, a memory-management optimization that should fly mostly under the radar. When Hannes Reinecke reported a crash in 6.14, though, frozen pages suddenly came into view. There is a workaround for this problem, but it seems there is a fair amount of work to be done that nobody had counted on to solve the problem properly.

item.title: Seven new stable kernels
item.description: Greg Kroah-Hartman has announced the release of the 6.13.7, 6.12.19, 6.6.83, 6.1.131, 5.15.179, 5.10.235, and 5.4.291 stable kernels. They all contain a relatively large number of important fixes throughout the kernel tree.

item.title: Security updates for Thursday
item.description: Security updates have been issued by Debian (chromium), Fedora (ffmpeg, qt6-qtwebengine, tigervnc, and xorg-x11-server-Xwayland), Red Hat (fence-agents and libxml2), SUSE (amazon-ssm-agent, ark, chromium, fake-gcs-server, gerbera, google-guest-agent, google-osconfig-agent, grafana, kernel, libtinyxml2-10, podman, python311, python312, restic, ruby3.4-rubygem-rack, and thunderbird), and Ubuntu (jinja2, linux-azure, linux-azure-4.15, linux-lts-xenial, linux-nvidia, linux-nvidia-6.8, linux-nvidia-lowlatency, netatalk, python3.5, python3.8, rar, unrar-nonfree, and xorg-server, xwayland).

item.title: Rusticl Wins: Mesa Officially Deprecates Clover OpenCL
item.description: With today's Mesa 25.1-devel Git code, the "Clover" OpenCL Gallium3D state tracker is officially deprecated. Clover will be eventually removed with the Rust-written Rusticl OpenCL driver being modern, much more actively maintained, and all-around a better option than the aging Clover code...

item.title: NVIDIA RTX Remix 1.0 Released With DXVK DLSS4 & Neural Radiance Cache
item.description: NVIDIA's RTX Remix software for remastering classic games with a variety of visual enhancements reached version 1.0 today with some additional big improvements...

item.title: AMDVLK 2025.Q1.3 Brings Radeon RX 9070 Series Support
item.description: AMD today released AMDVLK 2025.Q1.3 as their official open-source Vulkan API driver for Linux systems. With this update is support for the Navi48 GPU with the recently-launched Radeon RX 9070 RDNA4 graphics cards...
